intro: Allosidastrum interruptum, commonly known as the interrupted allosidastrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences with five petals. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
